Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP47
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP47.Network.Client

Class NetworkHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP47.Network.Client.NetworkHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
ViewListener, java.lang.Runnable
public class NetworkHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, ViewListener
This class handles the transfer of messages between the client and the server.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private class  NetworkHandler.MessageHandler
    This Runnable class handles the messages living the networkHandler free to receive ping messages.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private ClientTimer clientTimer  
    private java.io.ObjectInputStream inputServer  
    private boolean isConnected  
    private java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService messageExecutor  
    private NetworkHandlerVisitor networkHandlerVisitor  
    private java.io.ObjectOutputStream outputServer  
    private java.net.Socket serverSocket  
    private View view  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    NetworkHandler​(View view, java.net.Socket serverSocket)
    This constructor set up the management between the Client and the Server.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void dispatchMessages()
    This method dispatches the messages coming from the the server.
    void endConnection()
    This method close the client process with no errors.
    void handleFirstConnection()
    This method handles the first connection with the server, asking to the user to choose their username and the color they prefer for their workers.
    void run()
    This method instantiates the ObjectInputStream and the ObjectOutputStream with InputStream and OutputStream of the server's socket in order to handle serialization.
    void send​(Message message)
    This method serializes the messages and sends them to the server.
    void update​(Visitable visitableObject)
    This method implements the update of the Observer Pattern.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • NetworkHandler

      public NetworkHandler​(View view, java.net.Socket serverSocket)
      This constructor set up the management between the Client and the Server.
      Parameters:
      view - the View passed by the Client.
      serverSocket - the socket of the Server the user wants to connect to.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      This method instantiates the ObjectInputStream and the ObjectOutputStream with InputStream and OutputStream of the server's socket in order to handle serialization.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • dispatchMessages

      public void dispatchMessages()
      This method dispatches the messages coming from the the server. If the message is a ping it is handled, otherwise it forwards them to the runnable class NetworkHandler.MessageHandler.

    • send

      public void send​(Message message)
      This method serializes the messages and sends them to the server.
      Parameters:
      message - the message that must be sent.

    • endConnection

      public void endConnection()
      This method close the client process with no errors.
      Specified by:
      endConnection in interface ViewListener

    • handleFirstConnection

      public void handleFirstConnection()
      This method handles the first connection with the server, asking to the user to choose their username and the color they prefer for their workers.

    • update

      public void update​(Visitable visitableObject)
      This method implements the update of the Observer Pattern. It is called every time the view receives an input from the client, so its content is notified to the Network Handler.
      Specified by:
      update in interface ViewListener
      Parameters:
      visitableObject - the content of the input.
